articles.content:
Grand Mass Gymnastic and Artistic Performance "Arirang" Presented 
    Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The presentation of the grand mass gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang", a Kim Il Sung Prize laureate,  began with splendor at the May Day Stadium situated on Rungra Islet in Pyongyang Tuesday evening on the occasion of the 60th anniversaries of the Workers' Party of Korea and the liberation of Korea.
 Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, appreciated the performance.
 Also appreciating the performance were Kim Yong Nam, Jo Myong Rok, Pak Pong Ju and other senior officials of the Party, the state and the army and working people in the city.    
 Among the audience were members of a congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan, delegations and visiting groups of overseas Koreans and other overseas Koreans from various regions of the world who came here to attend the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of Korea's liberation. 
 Present there on invitation were visiting Konstantin Borisovich Pulikovski, presidential envoy to the Far East Federal District of Russia, and other delegations of Russia, foreign delegations and delegates including the participants in the Meeting Dedicated to the Great Persons of Mt. Paektu and the World Conference in Support of the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, foreign diplomatic envoys and embassy officials, representatives of international organizations here and foreign guests.    
 The performance began with the presentation of graceful dances on the field of the stadium to the tune of the song "Arirang" and the majestic sunrise over Mt. Paektu on its background. The extravaganza made a grandiose epical representation of the history of the sacred struggle waged by the Korean people, a history in which they have achieved independence and sovereignty, social progress and national prosperity through the heroic war of resistance and revolutionary changes, holding Kim Il Sung, the most distinguished great man, in high esteem as the father of the nation for the first time in the nation's history spanning 5,000 years.    
 The performance stunned the audience with fascinating scenes as it was a combination of music, dances, gymnastics and acrobatics rich in national flavor and high in artistry, ever-changing background, peculiar stage decor, electronic displays, laser lighting, etc.
 When the performance ended, cheers of "hurrah!" shook the stadium and fireworks were displayed in succession to beautifully decorate the nocturnal sky in August.
 Kim Jong Il waved back to the enthusiastically cheering performers and audience.
 He expressed great satisfaction with the successful re-depiction of the grand mass gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" and thanked all the performers in the name of the Central Committee of the WPK, the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and the DPRK government.

articles.title: Seoul Headquarters for Joint Events of Koreans Formed
articles.content:
Barbados Preparatory Committee Formed 
    Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- A Barbados preparatory committee for celebrating the 60th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea was formed in Bridgetown on August 8.
 David Denny, chairman of the Barbados Committee for Friendship and Solidarity with the Korean People, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The preparatory committee decided to organize multifarious political functions till October 10 marking the 60th anniversary of the WPK in the wake of the celebrations marking the 60th anniversary of Korea's liberation and conduct activities of giving wide publicity to the DPRK.

articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Yemeni Ambassador
    Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Yemeni Ambassador to the DPRK Marwan Avdulla Avdul Wahav Noman at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday. 
 On hand was Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Hyong Jun.    
 The president had a conversation with him after receiving the credentials.

articles.title: Leading Members of North Side's Delegations Pay Courtesy Call on Roh Moo Hyun
articles.content:
Pulikovski and His Party Return Home
    Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Konstantin Borisovich Pulikovski, presidential envoy to the Far East Region of the Russian Federation, and his party retuned home on Wednesday  after participating in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the liberation of Korea.
 They were seen off at the airport by Yon Hyong Muk, vice-chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, officials concerned and Ambassador Andrei Gennadiyevich Karlov and officials of the Russian embassy here.    
 During the stay in Pyongyang, they visited the hall of the national fine art exhibition for celebrating the 60th anniversary of the liberation of Korea and the Pyongyang Metro.
